verses.verse: A prayer<WH8605> of Habakkuk<WH2265> the prophet,<WH5030> according<WH5921> to Shigionoth.<WH7692>

Lord,<WH3068> I have heard<WH8085> the report<WH8088> about Thee [and] I fear.<WH3372> O Lord,<WH3068> revive<WH2421> Thy work<WH6467> in the midst<WH7130> of the years,<WH8141> In the midst<WH7130> of the years<WH8141> make<WH3045> it known;<WH3045> In wrath<WH7267> remember<WH2142> mercy.<WH7355>

God<WH433> comes<WH935> from Teman,<WH8487> And the Holy<WH6918> One<WH6918> from Mount<WH2022> Paran.<WH6290> Selah.<WH5542> His splendor<WH1935> covers<WH3680> the heavens,<WH8064> And the earth<WH776> is full<WH4390> of His praise.<WH8416>
[His] radiance<WH5051> is like the sunlight;<WH216> He has rays<WH7161> [flashing] from His hand,<WH3027> And there<WH8033> is the hiding<WH2253> of His power.<WH5797>
Before<WH6440> Him goes<WH1980> pestilence,<WH1698> And plague<WH7565> comes<WH3318> after<WH7272> Him.

He stood<WH5975> and surveyed<WH4058> the earth;<WH776> He looked<WH7200> and startled<WH9351> the nations.<WH1471> Yes, the perpetual<WH5703> mountains<WH2022> were shattered,<WH9455> The ancient<WH5769> hills<WH1389> collapsed.<WH7817> His ways<WH1979> are everlasting.<WH5769>
I saw<WH7200> the tents<WH168> of Cushan<WH3572> under<WH8478> distress,<WH205> The tent<WH3407> curtains<WH3407> of the land<WH776> of Midian<WH4080> were trembling.<WH7264>

Did the Lord<WH3068> rage<WH2734> against the rivers,<WH5104> Or<WH518> [was] Thine anger<WH639> against the rivers,<WH5104> Or<WH518> [was] Thy wrath<WH5678> against the sea,<WH3220> That Thou didst ride<WH7392> on Thy horses,<WH5483> On Thy chariots<WH4818> of salvation<WH3444>?
Thy bow<WH7198> was made<WH5783> bare,<WH6181> <WH5783> The rods<WH4294> of chastisement<WH561> were sworn.<WH7621> Selah.<WH5542> Thou didst cleave<WH1234> the earth<WH776> with rivers.<WH5104>

The mountains<WH2022> saw<WH7200> Thee [and] quaked;<WH9123> The downpour<WH2230> of waters<WH4325> swept<WH5674> by. The deep<WH8415> uttered<WH5414> forth<WH5414> its voice,<WH6963> It lifted<WH5375> high<WH7315> its hands.<WH3027>

Sun<WH8121> [and] moon<WH3394> stood<WH5975> in their places;<WH2073> They went<WH1980> away at the light<WH216> of Thine arrows,<WH2671> At the radiance<WH5051> of Thy gleaming<WH1300> spear.<WH2595>
In indignation<WH2195> Thou didst march<WH6805> through the earth;<WH776> In anger<WH639> Thou didst trample<WH1758> the nations.<WH1471>

Thou didst go<WH3318> forth<WH3318> for the salvation<WH3468> of Thy people,<WH5971> For the salvation<WH3468> of Thine anointed.<WH4899> Thou didst strike<WH4272> the head<WH7218> of the house<WH1004> of the evil<WH7563> To lay<WH6168> him open<WH6168> from thigh<WH3247> to neck.<WH6677> Selah.<WH5542>

Thou didst pierce<WH9344> with his own spears<WH4294> The head<WH7218> of his throngs.<WH6518> They stormed<WH5590> in to scatter<WH6327> us; Their exultation<WH5951> [was] like<WH3644> those Who devour<WH398> the oppressed<WH6041> in secret.<WH4565>
Thou didst tread<WH1869> on the sea<WH3220> with Thy horses,<WH5483> On the surge<WH9148> of many<WH7227> waters.<WH4325>

I heard<WH8085> and my inward<WH990> parts<WH990> trembled,<WH7264> At the sound<WH6963> my lips<WH8193> quivered.<WH6750> Decay<WH7538> enters<WH935> my bones,<WH6106> And in my place<WH8478> I tremble.<WH7264> Because<WH834> I must wait<WH5117> quietly<WH5117> for the day<WH3117> of distress,<WH6869> For the people<WH5971> to arise<WH5927> [who] will invade<WH1464> us.

Though<WH3588> the fig<WH8384> tree<WH8384> should not blossom,<WH6524> And there<WH369> be no<WH369> fruit<WH2981> on the vines,<WH1612> [Though] the yield<WH4639> of the olive<WH2132> should fail,<WH3584> And the fields<WH7709> produce<WH6213> no<WH3808> food,<WH400> Though the flock<WH6629> should be cut<WH1504> off<WH1504> from the fold,<WH4356> And there<WH369> be no<WH369> cattle<WH1241> in the stalls,<WH7517>
Yet I will exult<WH5937> in the Lord,<WH3068> I will rejoice<WH1523> in the God<WH430> of my salvation.<WH3468>

The Lord<WH136> God<WH3068> is my strength,<WH2428> And He has made<WH7760> my feet<WH7272> like hinds' [feet,] And makes me walk<WH1869> on my high<WH1116> places.<WH1116> For the choir<WH5329> director,<WH5329> on my stringed<WH5058> instruments.<WH5058>
